details.title: Range migration algorithm for airborne squint mode spotlight SAR imaging

kwd: airborne squint mode spotlight SAR imaging

authors.affiliation: Dept. of Electr. Eng. & Comput. Sci., Korea Adv. Inst. of Sci. & Technol., Daejeon
authors.name: H.-s. Shin

authors.affiliation: Dept. of Electr. Eng. & Comput. Sci., Korea Adv. Inst. of Sci. & Technol., Daejeon
authors.name: J.-t. Lim

details.abstract: Since the reference signal based on the fixed reference range is used in the range migration algorithm (RMA), the RMA is not available to process an airborne squint-mode spotlight synthetic aperture radar (SAR) data. Thus, the modified reference signal to transform a squint-mode data to a broadside-mode data is introduced on the basis of the coordinate transformation and the extended Taylor approximation. Then, using the principle of the stationary phase, the presented formulation is analysed. Moreover, to compensate curvature errors, the proposed method is extended on the basis of the subarea technique. Finally, the effectiveness of the proposed method is demonstrated by some numerical simulations via a pulsed spotlight SAR simulator

ieee.displayText: Hee-Sub Shin, Jong-Tae Lim, "Omega-k Algorithm for Airborne Spatial Invariant Bistatic Spotlight SAR Imaging", Geoscience and Remote Sensing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 47, pp. 238-250, 2009, ISSN 0196-2892.

ieee.displayText: Naivedya Mishra, Swamp S. Medasani, "Extended Omega-K Algorithm for high squint mode airborne SAR imaging with motion compensation", Microwave and RF Conference (IMaRC) 2014 IEEE International, pp. 352-355, 2014.
